intro: Clibadium armanii, commonly known as the Armanii sumpweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found near water bodies. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
